item.title: [DISTRELEC-6903] Catalog synchronization does not honor email template
item.description:
Some items will not be honored during a catalog synchronization. E.g.

  • PimImportNotificationEmailTemplate (type = EmailPageTemplate)
  • PimImportNotificationEmail (type = EmailPage)

On Q-System and P-System, these elements exist in both catalog versions - Default:Staged and Default:Online.
BUT on D-System as well as on all developer environments (Nabil, Will, Adi, René) the above elements exist in Default:Stage only.

=> Make synch of Default catalog working again.
item.summary: Catalog synchronization does not honor email template

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Looks like Raphael Husi added a configuration manually in Q-System and P-System.
I will add a proper impex script to ensure the config is the same in every environment.
Fixed. The synchronization will work correctly after the next SystemUpdate.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The currently configured email address (e-platform@distrelec.com) does not exist!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6885] Filter attribute names are not displayed fully - end replaced with ... on Q system
item.description:
Requirement
After 20 chars without space a line-break should be produced automatically. The start of the second line should be aligned with the first one.

Originial request
Attribute names are not fully displayed anymore but cropped and the end replaced by ...

This makes them in many cases useless because the vital information is in the back. As discussed with Rafael Burlet, this is nothing business wants to have as it is very customer unfriendly.

Furthermore, this is currently blocking us from testing the DQS data as we do not know which facet we look at and therefore cannot check the data neither in FF nor in PIM. This needs to be fixed asap as it is blocking our testing.

http://test.distrelec.at/search?q=diode&filter_Breakdown%20Spannung%20min.~~V=125+-+522&page=1&pageSize=10&lang=de
item.summary: Filter attribute names are not displayed fully - end replaced with ... on Q system

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please test after the next deployment (this afternoon).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6871] Aborted request in search result page
item.description:
When clicking on one item of a search result a request is fired that will be aborted. Most probably this is a Javascript issue.

Steps to reproduce:

  • Open http://www.distrelec.ch in Firefox with Firebug enabled.
  • Search for something and hit ENTER (e.g. "Knickschutztülle gelb").
  • In the search result hit the first result item

Two things that are strange but might have the same reason:

  1. The Firebug "Net" tab shows an aborted request. The target page "...../p/11060820....." is not properly requested.
  2. If you hit the first item in combination with the <CTRL> key in order to open the product detail page in a separate browser tab, the search result page is being RELOADED which is not desired.

Please tackle the issue. Not sure whether this issue is trivial or critical. But could be the reason for the language switch problem (DISTRELEC-6486).

A flaw in XHR could be the cause: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12116641/how-to-solve-firebug-s-aborted-messages-upon-ajax-requests
item.summary: Aborted request in search result page

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hi Adi, As discussed - please have a look with Beat Stadler from Namics.

Fixed. And <CTRL>+Click is now working as desired, too.
Hope this will also fix the language switch problem (DISTRELEC-6486).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6659] SAP // Deactivate customer through department code 9999
item.description:
Department Code "9999":
This will be the value for the Webshop to recognize that the contact person should is deactivated
http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/ERP+Codelist+-+DistDepartment

If we get the DistDepartment Code 9999 from SAP we should deactivate the contact.

If a deactivated contact person tries to login we should display the message" Your account is locked, please contact our customer care team" and in German "Ihr Zugang ist gesperrt, bitte wenden sie sich an unseren Kundendienst“
item.summary: SAP // Deactivate customer through department code 9999

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate, thx.

This approach is not the correct one. It does not make sense to deactivate a customer according to his/her department code. The soap response form SAP should contain a boolean flag saying the contact is active or not.

Is it possible that you implement some kind of Flag on SAP-side which is set when departement code 9999 is applied on the contact. We'll check this flag then from Webshop-side. What would be the impact?

Hello Rafael,
As we discussed this means a change on the read customer interface by adding one more field. The current solution needs to change and has been already implemented from our side. Please let me know how we will proceed
We will implement the "9999" dpt. code solution because of less efforts from SAP side. Otherwise the interface needs a CR.

Using the flag "active" only is not enough because even if the contact is not active he/she can still login in hybris. However, to disable the login, we need to set the flag "Login disabled" to true and the "Activated with Double Opt-In" to false. In this way we ensure that this contact will not be able to login in the future.

One main problem is if a contact has been deactivated in SAP but not yet in hybris, then we have the following scenarios:

  1. If the customer is B2C, then the contact will be able to login the first time but updated as deactivated in hybris. Next time he wont be able to login.
  2. If the customer is B2B:
  • If the deactivated contact isis the first one who logs in after the deactivation, here we have the same case as 1.
  • If another, active, contact already logged in just after the deactivation of the contact, then the contact is updated in hybris and he wont be able to login anymore.

That's fine for me - Can we implement a warning-message like this:
"Sorry, your account has been deactivated. Please contact customer service: Tel: [customer-service telnumber of respective country]
Email: [cusotmer-service email of respective country]"
?
Yes this is feasible. I already implemented this logic.
fixed.
Has been deployed to Q - Please test, thanks.

Login: urs.bebie+test99@gmail.com
PW: Sensirion

I tested with the user above but it has not worked. I was able to login without error message although the contact person has the department 9999
After I have deleted this value on SAP site I was no longer able to login. I received the message "Your username or password was incorrect. If your login is not working anymore you can use the "registration with customer number" functionality in order to connect again with your active account..

Could you check it, please?
Nabil, please check last comment from Urs, thx.
fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6636] Old migrated customers that have a username and not an e-mail address as username, have the feedback form pre-filled with username, not e-mail address
item.description:
In the message from customer below, we have 2 issues, one with regards to the filter, and second with regards to the fact that the feedback form is prefilled with username, and not with e-mail address, for old customers, please change this.
______________________________________________________________________________________________________
Webshop-Support:       Wann kommen endlich die Min/Max – Filter?

Marketing MDM:           Bitte Daten cleansen (einheitlich 12VDC, …)

 

Email nur zur Kenntnisnahme.

 

Mit freundlichen Grüssen

Beat Eugster
Stv. Leiter Technischer Support

 

Von: Feedback von [[1]mailto:robert.freudenmann@streckeisen.biz]
Gesendet: Montag, 30. März 2015 10:46
An: FM CH DIS Info
Betreff: Feedback

 

Feedback von:
Robert Freudenmann ([2]robert.freudenmann@streckeisen.biz)
Feedback:

Es ist sehr frustrierend, hier etwas zu suchen. Ich suche ein ACDC Gerät mit 12V Ausgang zwischen 100 und 250W. Ich habe zur Auswahl: Ausgangsspannung, Ausgangspannung1 (?!), dann 12V oder auch 12VDC oder auch Nominal 12V (?!). Weiter kann ich keinen Bereich wählen, sondern muss sämtliche Möglichkeiten, bei denen 100..200W vorkommen anwählen, also 100W, 100..120W, 120W usw. Früher konnte man das, bei anderen Bewerbern geht das auch... Ach noch was, im E-Mail dieses Feedbackformulars wird jeweils automatisch der Benutzername eingetragen, statt das EMail, so vieles funktioniert hier nicht... Diese site frustiert mich immer mehr...
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[1] robert.freudenmann@streckeisen.biz
[2] robert.freudenmann@streckeisen.biz

Hi Will,

The problem is in DE language, we have categories that have the same name in PIM but do have different category IDs (you can see that in the screenshot PIM-families.png).

In FF backend you can see that the products have the right category ID from PIM.

It seems that the shop is grouping the products according to the category name and not to the ID.

Does this make the issue more clear to you?

Thanks,
Laura
Wrote my analysis in an email to Mr Türk. Wait for his answer.

Hallo Herr Spalinger,

die Anzeige eines Produktes auf Produktübersichtsseiten, hängt von mehreren Faktoren ab:

  • erfolgreicher Import der CSV-Datei
  • kein Ausschluss über Ranking-Regeln
  • kein Ausschluss über das ExcludeProductsSearchCallback-Kriterium
  • eine ausreichend hohe Bandbreite (Konfiguration > Relevanz), um sämtliche der Kategorie zugehörige Produkte auszuliefern

Ist sichergestellt, dass diese Faktoren in den Channels übereinstimmen?

Für eine kurze Rückmeldung wäre ich Ihnen dankbar.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

I checke now the categoryPath of two products: 14824272 & 14821460. In DE DE both are shown. In DE EN only one is shown: 14824272

DE-DE:
http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/Kabelverbinder/c/cat-26487

DE-EN:
http://www.distrelec.de/en/Components/Cables-%26-Installation-Materials/Cable-Lugs-Crimp-Terminals/Splice-Connectors%2C-Coloured/Butt-Connectors/c/cat-26487

14824272: CategoryPathROOT=Components|CategoryPathROOT/Components=Cables & Installation Materials|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials=Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals=Splice Connectors, Coloured|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured=Butt Connectors| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured/Butt Connectors=Butt Connector|
14821460: CategoryPathROOT=Components|CategoryPathROOT/Components=Cables & Installation Materials|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials=Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals=Splice Connectors, Coloured|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured=Splice Connector| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured/Splice Connector=ELECTRO-TAP|

Then I checked the category structure of the products in hmc. The category structure is completly different, thats why we they have a different category path.

Also check this two category urls (same results size):

http://www.distrelec.de/en/Components/Cables-%26-Installation-Materials/Cable-Lugs-Crimp-Terminals/Splice-Connectors%2C-Coloured/c/cat-21115
-> containing 3 child categories

http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/c/cat-21115
-> containing no child categories

I will have a look at this issue together with Daniela.

Cheers
Will

Hallo Herr Türk

Herr Spalinger und ich sitzen gerade zusammen und schauen uns das Ganze an. Wir machen schon eine Filterung via ID, allerdings scheint diese bei gleichen Kategorienamen nicht zu greifen. Als Beispiel:

http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/Kabelverbinder/c/cat-26487
26487 ist eine Familie in PIM, die 3 Produkte enthält.

Die Überkategorie (http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/c/cat-21115) enthält vier aktive Sub-Kategorien (Familien) mit demselben Namen.

Wie Sie sehen, führen beide Links auf praktisch dieselbe Produktauswahl, obwohl wir im ersten Fall ein Level tiefer sind und nur drei Produkte sehen sollten.

Können Sie sich das bitte anschauen und uns sagen, woran dass das liegt? Herr Spalinger schaut sich ebenfalls auch noch mal an, ob von unserer Seite her nicht noch Parameter mitgegeben werden, die das Resultat verfälschen.

Vielen Dank für Ihr Feedback & freundliche Grüsse
Daniela Truttmann

Customer Experience Manager

Hallo Frau Truttmann,
ich gehe davon aus, dass die generierte FACT-Finder Anfrage nicht stimmt. Das Ergebnis unterscheidet sich, wie die Verwendung von vier oder fünf Kategorie-Ebenen über das FACT-Finder Backend veranschaulicht:
5 Ebenen:
http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&navigation=true&filterCategory1=Komponenten&filterCategory2=Kabel+%26+Installationsmaterial&filterCategory3=Kabelschuhe+%2F+Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse&filterCategory4=Kabelverbinder+farbig&filterCategory5=Kabelverbinder

4 Ebenen:
http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&navigation=true&filterCategory1=Komponenten&filterCategory2=Kabel+%26+Installationsmaterial&filterCategory3=Kabelschuhe+%2F+Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse&filterCategory4=Kabelverbinder+farbig
Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
Will be discussed with Daniela on 21.05.2015

Hallo Herr Türk

Wir haben das nun intern angeschaut. Da wir im Request ja bereits den Kategorie code mitschicken, könnten Sie einen Lookup nach productFamilyCode machen und falls dieser keine Resultate liefert den normalen Lookup wie bis anhin per Kategoriename in den Filtern?

Wir müssten wissen ob das so möglich ist und wieviel uns das kosten würde.

Besten Dank für Ihr Feedback und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
ist mit "Lookup", der Einfluss auf die gefilterte Produktliste oder die Facetten-Anzeige/Sortierung gemeint?
Wird im FACT-Finder Request auch der genannte Code übermittelt?
Schon jetzt danke für eine kurze Rückmeldung.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
*************************
Hallo Herr Türk

Ja genau das ist damit gemeint. Der genannte Code wird bereits im FF request übermittelt.

Besten Dank für Ihr Feedback und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
danke für die Info. In den Suchlogs konnte ich kein Vorkommnis dazu finden.
Wird der Code als Parameter oder als Filter übertragen? Könnten Sie mir bitte den Soap-Request als XML-Datei zukommen lassen?
Vielen Dank im Voraus.
Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

Hallo Herr Türk

Ich habe gerade den SOAP request überprüft und festgestellt das wir den Kategoriecode noch nicht mitschicken. Ich habe das nun angepasst, dann würden wir bei einer Kategoriesuche die Filter wie gehabt und neu noch den „query“ parameter mit dem Kategoriecode senden.

Würde das für Sie so funktionieren?

Im Anhang finden Sie den angepassten search request. --> http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/18335/soap_request_category-search.txt

Besten Dank und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
danke für die Infos.
Das würde mit dem query-Parameter nicht funktionieren, da der Einsatz des "navigation=true" Parameters den übermittelten Suchbegriff überschreibt.
Ich schlage vor, dass der Code als weiterer Filter übermittelt wird, sofern er einen Unterschied bewirkt. Hierbei reicht es aus, den Code als Filter im Request zu übermitteln. Eine dazugehörige Filter-Gruppe braucht für diesen Zweck nicht unter Konfiguration > ASN / Navigation eingerichtet zu werden.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
**********************
Hallo Herr Türk

Besten Dank für die Info. Dann werde ich den code als weiteren Filter übermitteln. Wie soll der Filter heissen? Ns2:name?

                       <ns2:Filter>
                            <ns2:name>Category5</ns2:name>
                            <ns2:valueList>
                                <ns2:FilterValue>
                                    <ns2:type>or</ns2:type>
                                    <ns2:value>Kabelverbinder</ns2:value>
                                </ns2:FilterValue>
                            </ns2:valueList>
                        </ns2:Filter>

Schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
der Filtername entspricht hier dem Namen des Feldes aus dem CSV-Export, d.h: productFamilyCode.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
Committed in v3.4 branch. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6393] Searches count double in reports
item.description:
The search reports have the "number of searches" duplicated, reason for this is that by searching for a query only once, it is counted as twice.

I perform the search "testsearch" only one time in each webshop and in the reports is counted as 2 times, except for LT channel (see screenshot from CH_DE as example)

I suspect that this is happening since January as we hardly have single searches, when we usually have may, and the amount of searches is almost double as previous months.

Please investigate this issue and find a solution for to fix the reports.
Thanks,
Laura

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Statt
fileName=ff.$(date --utc --date='1 days ago' +%Y%m%d)$extension
müsste es wie folgt lauten:
fileName=ff.$(date --date='1 days ago' +%Y%m%d)$extension

Hallo Herr Türk

Wir haben das Ganze noch einmal von unserer Seite aus überprüft. Wir sehen im Apache Log jeweils immer 2 Zeilen:

127.0.0.1 - - [27/May/2015:13:52:46 +0200] "POST /FACT-Finder-hybris/webservice/ws69/Search HTTP/1.1" 200 38956 "-" "Apache CXF 2.4.2"
127.0.0.1 - - [27/May/2015:13:52:53 +0200] "POST /FACT-Finder-hybris/webservice/ws69/Search HTTP/1.1" 200 283363 "-" "Apache CXF 2.4.2"

Die erste ist der getSuggest Request und die zweite ist der getResult Request. Können Sie Ihre Log Einstellungen überprüfen?

Besten Dank und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger
**************************
Hallo Herr Türk

Ergänzend sehen wir folgendes im FF log für nur einen Search Request:

[hybris@datblbk01001x(env-hp-p-app 00):/data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/logs]$ grep dc82c78ea60cab3754ed7db6cc76e6f9 ///ff.20150522.
datblbk03001x/distrelec_P_7310_ch_de/daily/ff.20150522.log:Fri May 22 13:25:14 2015: Found 0 records for search [dc82c78ea60cab3754ed7db6cc76e6f9] in [1048], BestSimi [0], MinSimi [0], FieldNr [-1], WordWise [0], FilterField [], Filter [], AdditionalInfo [],Page [1], PageSize [10] <0>

Beste Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,

danke für die letzten Infos.
Offenbar liegt es doch an der Ausführungshäufigkeit des Merge-Skriptes. Der Server mit der Kennung datlupk03004x ist die Quelle für den Logeintrag. Im Zielsystem wird der Eintrag zwei Mal aufgenommen. Je Merge-Lauf wird eine leere Zeile vor einem neuen Logzeilen-Block platziert:

In der Datei /data_nfs/env-hp-p/factfinder/ff-resources/FACT-Finder-hybris/conf/applicationjobs.properties ist ein Quartz-Job über folgenden Eintrag konfiguriert:

job.information.provider.externalProcess =

{APP_RESOURCES}

/customClasses/fff-commonClasses-current.jar!/de.factfinder.common.scheduler.ExternalProcessJobInformationProvider

Ist zusätzlich ein Systemseitiger Cronjob eingerichtet, der auch das Merge-Skript ausführt? Dann schlage ich vor, dass die o.g. Zeile aus der FACT-Finder Konfiguration entfernt wird.

Bei Fragen erreichen Sie mich unter +49 7231/12597-414

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
Removed external process configuration parameter, as described by Mr. Türk. Committed in v3.4 branch. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5163] SEO - Http Access Log Export & Storage
item.description:
Observations :

  • Http logs are the only data we can rely at 100% on for seo/sem/BI analitycs.
  • Hybris http & https access logs are saved for 1 week on our web server.

Impacts :

  • We can't analyse over the time and with an easy workflow the primary data of our webplateform.

Demands :

  • 1) Merge www_distrelec_access_log & ssl_prod_distrelec_access_log and nodes per day with this pattern : YYYY-MM-DD_distrelec_access_log.log
  • 2) Store on an ftp server those merged access_log for 2 years.
  • 3) This ftp space must be accessible to other servers through NFS sharing.

Checking process :

  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Http Access Log Export & Storage

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The logs have been delivered.

Yes, but this issue is not about that.
Please read.

Hello Pierre

I really don't like the idea of merging the files together.

  • the files are already big enough
  • the is no central server to do this
  • maybe we will need this files also for other tools and there we would nee to know from what server (node) they are.

Would it be possible to make a proper naming of the files and look for a place to store them?

Possible naming-pattern:

{YYYY-MM-DD}_distrelec_{nodeX}_access_{ssl}_log.log

It's ok for me with this pattern if it's necessary to analyse data on different nodes.
Indeed a dedicated storage/server have to be setup.

@Pierre
When you change the priority of an issue, can you please add a comment, so I can understand your motivation.

Thanks René

@Rene :
It's purely for the organizational overview.
Since I closed several ticket, I globally reassess all the seo related ticket and up/down rank them if necessary.
I ranked it up, since I was asked to accelerate all the monitoring related task.
No direct impact for you.
Thanks
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/programs/rotatelogs.html

Original CombinedApacheLog:

%{IPORHOST:clientip} %{USER:ident} %{USER:auth} \[%{HTTPDATE:timestamp}\] "(?:%{WORD:verb} %{NOTSPACE:request}(?: HTTP/%{NUMBER:httpversion})?|%{DATA:rawrequest})" %{NUMBER:response} (?:%{NUMBER:bytes}|-) %{QS:referrer} %{QS:agent}

Currently in use:

%{IPORHOST:clientip} %{USER:ident} %{USER:auth} \[%{HTTPDATE:timestamp}\] %{QS:virtualhost} \"(?:%{WORD:verb} %{NOTSPACE:request}(?: HTTP/%{NUMBER:httpversion})?|%{DATA:rawrequest})\" %{NUMBER:response} (?:%{NUMBER:bytes}|-)  %{QS:referrer} %{QS:agent} %{NUMBER:responsetime}

New configuration to use:

  • place % {QS:virtualhost}

    after %

    {QS:agent}
  • remove additional space before % {QS:referrer}
%{IPORHOST:clientip} %{USER:ident} %{USER:auth} \[%{HTTPDATE:timestamp}\] "(?:%{WORD:verb} %{NOTSPACE:request}(?: HTTP/%{NUMBER:httpversion})?|%{DATA:rawrequest})" %{NUMBER:response} (?:%{NUMBER:bytes}|-) %{QS:referrer} %{QS:agent} %{QS:virtualhost} %{NUMBER:responsetime}
Add response TIme to Apache Logs on App-Servers

all done!

Logfiles are moved to archive every night.
Please wait until one day after the deployment of v3.4.1 before testing.

Great News !!!!
Thx Rene !
